name: Bordeaux Chateau B&B

reviews.text: We were looking for a B&B near Bordeaux and the one we had chosen from the Internet was full. They recommended Chateau Bellevue. It was the most pleasant surprise of our trip. It is a totally renovated 19th century chateau totally surrounded by vineyards. They actually have their own tiny vineyard in front. The rooms were spotless and impeccably decorated with an eclectic mixture of antique and very contemporary furniture and art. The rooms ran from 100 to 120 Euros and there was a lovely dinner, with wine, available for 30 Euros more. The owner and host, Petra, is from Germany and could not be more welcoming. She made our stay the highlight of our trip. In less than half an hour, you can visit some of the best wineries in France.
reviews.title: Unforgettable chateau near Bordeaux!

likes.liked: — The beautiful surroundings, both in and out.

reviews.text: We found this chateau on trip advisor and we absolutely loved it. It's a wonderful place to stay if you are visiting the Bordeaux region. The chateau is very beautiful and is decorated so nicely, with wonderful painings done by Petra herself. The rooms are luxurious. The views of the vineywards and the Gironde river are also wonderful. The swimming pool is new and a lovely place to spend a few hours. Breakfast was also great, a wide selection to choose from, the best we had in France.
reviews.title: Wow wow wow

reviews.text: Petra and her husband are wonderful hosts. On the first night, we shared a bottle of wine with her by the pool which was lovely. They were both very kind and helpful throughout our stay and recommended great restaurants to eat in.
reviews.title: Beautiful chateau with wonderful hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have recently returned from Chateau Bellevue near Bordeaux and had the most wonderful weekend in this beautiful chateau. We had booked fairly late for our whole family (17 people including young children, teenagers and grandparents) to celebrate a golden wedding anniversary. From the initial booking, Petra went out of her way to help us give the golden couple a wonderful celebration. She booked a local restaurant for one evening and gave us a real celebratory dinner on the Saturday night, including local oysters and a special cake from the local patisserie. Her champagne punch with fresh fruit is the best drink in the world... !
reviews.title: An amazing stay!

reviews.text: Out stay at the Chateau was originally booked for two nights, and we stayed 5!!! It was one of the highlights of all my travels. The castle is just what you see in the photos, but what you can't appreciate are vistas from all sides. It is truly a romantic and offers a spectacular setting for a wedding, engagement, holiday or wine tour.

reviews.text: It is located about 40 minutes from Bordeaux, it is actually in the beautiful countryside outside Bordeaux with a stunning views of the Gironde River and the vineyards of the Medoc region. There are so many nice village within easy reach of the chateau; a car is recommended for visiting the environs.

Wonderful memories and a great welcoming from the hospitable staff contributed immensely to the stay. Actually it is more as though we were staying in your own home.. We were three (couple and a single) but the chateau can accommodate more very easily.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights at this beautiful chateau, located in the vineyards north of Bordeaux. The chateau was like something out of a fairy tale, and the views were spectacular! Peaceful and quiet -- you wake up to the birds chirping in the morning. The 5 available rooms were large and comfortable, and the marble bathroom had all modern fixtures. Petra, our hostess, was very friendly and outgoing, and gave us a very warm welcome. She advised us on where to go, where to dine, and what to do in the area. This is the famous Bordeaux wine country -- the Medoc region is just across the river from the chateau, easily accessible by ferry. I just wish we could have spent more than just the 3 nights we had reserved in our vacation itinerary. I can heartily recommend this to any traveler. But note: you really need to rent a car to get around in this area.
reviews.title: Unforgettable romantic getaway

reviews.text: We enjoyed every minute of our stay at the castle. It is the most perfect place to spend a romantic weekend. The peace and quiet, the views and the atomosphere are amazing! We particularly enjoyed the wine-tours and food from the local market, but our highlight was the "honeymoon" Chamapgne-Salmon breakfast! Petra you made our stay unforgettable. Thank you for everything. We will certainly come back in the near future.
reviews.title: The most amazing Chateau in France

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have had the pleasure of staying at Chateau Bellevue many time, Thanks Rudy and Petra, If you are looking for a fantastic personal service, and a beautiful setting, then this is the place you should be booking. Just take a look at the website and pictures, to fully appreciate the Chateau you have to see it for real.
reviews.title: Wine & art in a French Chateau
